review: I only got it to be able to airplay video from my computer, ipad, etc to my television.  There's really no way to put other then it fails miserable in any way I can think of for playing video.  It takes longer to download something then the actual length of the show or movie.  20-30 minutes for a 12 minute show is about average.  And before some apple fanboy makes an excuse my ps3 (which is almost a decade old) streams netflix, hulu, etc with no lag at all.  So it has everything to do with the apple device itself.  If you don't mind waiting a ridiculous amount of time to watch a program then once it actually has it ready to play, it plays fine.  You just have to plan well in advance when you want to watch a program.  None of the methods tech support has suggested have worked.  Not that it would make it better if I had to constantly fiddle with the device for it to work properly.  It should work properly and without having to do anything other then set it up once.

review: This is from a longtime Appleboy.  This purchase was a huge mistake.  If you are tempted to buy this bad apple, do yourself a favor, go online and Google "I keep getting a 'Connection Failed because your HDMI cable does not support HDCP'" message.  If you don't heed this warning from the depths of Electronica Hell, you may be in for one of the worst mental journeys of your life.  To think that I was once a fairly normal human being, rather than the raving lunatic I have become, forced to type with a pencil stub because my arms are so tightly wrapped--when the guards aren't looking, that is.
